poem:
**Two Visions**

The words clutter,
echoes of trash talk
in the hollow rooms.

Harris weaves futures,
while shadows clutch
at Trump's bygone past.

In the jumbled noise,
two visions emerge,
one stepping forward,
one grasping dust.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Top Republican urges party to stop ‘trash talk’ as Trump faces criticism from all sides for Harris race comments – live 7.04pm BST Harris: 'This campaign is about two different visions for our nation' In a new tweet on Thursday, Kamala Harris wrote: “This campaign is about two different visions for our nation. Ours if focused on the future. Donald Trump’s is focused on the past. We’re not going back.” This campaign is about two". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
